definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Today this is known as a ★ steelyard scale 13 .
sentences.chinese: 如今這種天平被稱作“桿秤”。

sentences.english: The symbol of Libra is the scales of a balance.
sentences.chinese: 天秤座的標誌是一架平衡的天平。

sentences.english: Lots of Libra people are artistic and appreciate beautiful things.
sentences.chinese: 許多天平座人都很有藝術細胞而和審美眼光。

sentences.english: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
sentences.chinese: 以法蓮是商人，手裏有詭詐的天平，愛行欺騙。

sentences.english: All Libras die of venereal disease.
This balance is made of tool steel.
sentences.chinese: 天平是用工具鋼製成的。

sentences.english: If there are scales, the pans don't move.
sentences.chinese: 如果有天平，秤盤不會動。

sentences.english: Being designed with agate cushion, the sensitivity and accuracy of balances will be guarantied .
sentences.chinese: 採用瑪瑙刀座，保證了天平的靈敏度和準確性。

sentences.english: It actually seems to come from the opposite end of the love-hate spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，它似乎來源於愛與恨的天平的另一端。

sentences.english: The gravity of this downward turn in the balance of safety oppressed my mind.
sentences.chinese: 安全的天平發生這種一頭沉的轉變，我心裏十分不安。

sentences.english: The Principle of the least squares method is applied to the static calibration of strain guage balances.
sentences.chinese: 本文將最小二乘法原理應用於應變式天平的靜校。

sentences.english: Over the past 10 years, the global balance of power tipped towards the east.
sentences.chinese: 在過去10年間，國際間權力的天平向東方傾斜。

sentences.english: Even this, sort the-- I have to get the damn scale again, right?
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，我還是得用天平，對吧？

sentences.english: Between thee and me the scale hangs fairly balanced.
sentences.chinese: 在你我之間，天平保持了相當的平衡。

sentences.english: So next year don't pick up the scale.
sentences.chinese: 明年我不會再帶天平來了。

sentences.english: Never­theless, the balance had shifted in favor of small organizations.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，當時天平還是偏向了小型企業一側。

definition: standard weight (used on a balance scale)
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
wind direction/the way the wind is blowing/fig. trends (esp. unpredictable ones)/how things are developing/course of events
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
initiative (as in "seize the initiative")/advantageous position that allows one to call the shots
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
